data.title: Listen to Juice WRLDâ€™s â€œGirl of My Dreamsâ€ With BTSâ€™s Suga on Posthumous Album
data.meta_description: Juice WRLD and Suga of BTS released a new song together, "Girl of My Dreams," off of Juice WRLD's posthumous album "Fighting Demons."
data.text:
Two years after Juice WRLD passed away at the age of 21, his legacy lives on in a new posthumous album, Fighting Demons. The album â€” an intimate record about anxiety, depression, and seeking help â€” has a few features, including none other than BTS rapper Suga.

Suga and Juice WRLDâ€™s song is titled â€œGirl of My Dreams,â€ and it was written by Juice WRLD (Jarad Anthony Higgins), Joshua Jaramillo, Karim, Jaegen, Max Lord and SUGA. Itâ€™s an emotional track about an all-consuming, albeit heart-breaking love. Juice WRLD raps over a beat that carefully balances rock and trap, â€œAll of me loves all of you, like I'm John Legend or somethin'/Better save some room, for my heart, it's a big one.â€ Suga later chimes in with his own verse, per translation from @doyou__bangtan: â€œAnother name for love is blue/Whatâ€™s refreshing can otherwise feel cold/Love always accompanies loneliness/Even when together the loneliness is present.â€

When talking about the late rapper in the album trailer, Suga said, â€œI loved his talent.â€ The â€œDaechwitaâ€ rapper, who is hailed for his lyrics and the profound way he talks about anxiety and mental health, went on to say that he found connection in Juice WRLDâ€™s songs. â€œI personally related a lot to the messages he tried to convey,â€ he said.

Ahead of the release, rapper Lil Bibby â€” who had signed Juice WRLD to his label Grade A Productions â€” shared pictures on Instagram of Suga in the studio. â€œThanks Suga for joining the fight ğŸ‘ŠğŸ½ğŸ˜ˆ,â€ he captioned the post.
